mdRecord.dcterms:title: To the publick
To the public
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Smith, Meriwether, 1730-1790 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Text printed in two columns and signed, in print, at end: Meriwether Smith. [original]
Smith defends himself against "scandalous and unjust" charges accusing him of official misconduct as a member of the Privy Council, where he served from November 1776 through May of 1777. [original]

Publication details are based on the bookseller's statement that the sheet was originally discovered bound with a set of Alexander Purdie's Virginia Gazette, 1776-1777, and that the type is identical to the type used in other publications by Purdie. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Tracy W. McGregor Library, American History Collection. McGregor Endowment Fund, 2007/2008. The bookseller's description is housed in folder with the text. [original]
